call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - October 17th 2024

topics.title: Ergo 6.0 Soft Fork Development Progress
topics.summary: Kushti reports significant progress on Ergo 6.0 activation with sub-blocks parameter voting working on DevNet. The soft fork implementation is proving less complex than initially expected, with 5.0 and 6.0 nodes successfully coexisting.

topics.title: Database Migration from LevelDB to RocksDB
topics.summary: Testing continues on RocksDB database replacement with mixed results on different hardware. Performance varies between SSDs and HDDs, with better Windows compatibility and crash durability.

topics.title: Ergo 2030 Vision and Protocol Evolution
topics.summary: Discussion of long-term Ergo vision extending to 2030 and beyond, emphasizing building robust, evolving protocols that grow communities rather than causing splits. Kushti draws from experiences with NXT blockchain's community fragmentation due to frequent hard forks.

topics.title: Lessons from Bitcoin and Ethereum Community Splits
topics.summary: Analysis of how community splits in Bitcoin (Core vs Cash vs SV) and Ethereum (Classic split) influenced Ergo's governance design. The 90% consensus requirement for protocol changes aims to prevent destructive community fragmentation.

topics.title: Decentralized vs Centralized Protocol Governance
topics.summary: Comparison between modern centralized foundation-controlled blockchains and Ergo's community-driven approach. Discussion of how centralization leads to silent user migration between chains rather than constructive discussion.

topics.title: Community Empowerment and Individual Impact Potential
topics.summary: QX emphasizes how newcomers to Ergo can create significant impact with minimal resources, contrasting this with other ecosystems. Discussion of the foreign concept of individual empowerment in today's crypto landscape.

topics.title: Sigmanauts Update: Rosen Bridge and Mining Pool
topics.summary: Updates on Rosen Bridge ETH launch readiness with 30 watchers, Sigmanauts mining pool reaching 72-73 gigahash, and ongoing storage rent collection. Discussion of new NFT-based mining configuration system being developed.

topics.title: Sigma Shop Marketplace and Escrow Services
topics.summary: Plans for expanding Sigma Shop to include physical goods marketplace with escrow services for items like mining hardware. The service would provide testing and certification of used equipment with cross-chain payment support.

topics.title: MewFinance Launch Success and Integration
topics.summary: Report on MewFinance's successful token launch with rapid sellout of multiple rounds. The platform uses modified Spectrum code with custom branding and has integrated themes into Erg Explorer.

topics.title: Ecosystem Participation and DAO Engagement
topics.summary: Call for increased participation in ecosystem DAOs like DuckPools and Sigmanauts DAO. Emphasis on moving from passive to active investment through voting, proposals, and treasury utilization to build local economies.

topics.title: Bug Reporting and Developer Collaboration
topics.summary: Discussion of the importance of detailed bug reports for developers and the accessibility of Ergo's development team. Most issues can be resolved quickly with proper information and community collaboration.

topics.title: Physical Goods Trading and Hardware Wallets
topics.summary: Encouragement for community members to sell physical goods on marketplaces like MewMart. Update on hardware wallet integrations including completed Ledger/Trezor/Flex support and upcoming Tangem and Keystone integrations.

topics.title: Mining Economics and Automated Investment
topics.summary: Discussion of GPU mining profitability and automated investment opportunities. Plans for miners to automatically split payments between different assets and DeFi protocols like DuckPools lending.

topics.title: UTXO Innovation and Composable Primitives
topics.summary: Exploration of Ergo's unique UTXO capabilities including peer-to-peer auctions and composable primitives. Discussion of how UTXO design enables more secure and flexible contracts compared to account-based systems.

topics.title: Community Town Hall Format Proposal
topics.summary: Proposal to try Zoom-based community town halls instead of Twitter Spaces to enable more open discussion format. The change would allow for free-form community conversations rather than structured presentations.

topics.title: AI-Assisted ErgoScript Development
topics.summary: Discussion of using AI tools like ChatGPT and Claude for ErgoScript development. Kushti explains common security issues in UTXO scripts and suggests AI could be helpful for finding forgotten conditions while emphasizing the need for verification.

topics.title: TVL Reporting Discrepancies
topics.summary: Community question about TVL dropping from 11 million to 1.6 million on CoinGecko. Glasgow is investigating the discrepancy and will contact CoinGecko to verify their calculation methodology.

topics.title: Exchange Listings and SigmaUSD Updates
topics.summary: Brief update on Kraken listing application status (still under review) and question about SigmaUSD bank update options including code updates and minting limits, though discussion is cut off.
